contentrichtext.text: {{refimprove|date=November 2009}} {{Infobox musical artist <!-- For individuals; see Wikipedia:WikiProject_Musicians --> | name = Shirley Childress Saxton | image = | alt = | caption = | image_size = | background = non_vocal_instrumentalist | birth_name = Shirley Childress | birth_date = | death_date = | origin = [[Washington, D.C.]] | instrument = | genre = | occupation = | years_active = 1980–present | label = | associated_acts = [[Sweet Honey in the Rock]] | website = }} '''Shirley Childress Saxton''' is an [[African-American]] American Sign Language instructor and interpreter. Since 1980, she has performed with [[Sweet Honey in the Rock]]. <ref>{{cite news |first=Katti |last=Gray |title=Sweet Honey in the Rock delivers protests, ballads |work=Chicago Tribune |date=2005-11-06 |page=6 (Tempo) |quote=Shirley Childress Saxton, who translates the singing into American Sign Language, came aboard in 1980. }}</ref> ==Biography== ===Early life and education=== Shirley Childress was born and reared in [[Washington, D.C.]] to [[deaf]] parents, Herbert and Thomasina Childress, making [[ASL|American Sign Language]] her first language. She has two sisters, Maxine Childress Brown and Dr. Khaula Murtadha Watts.<ref name="souls">{{cite book |editor1-first=Dawn Marie |editor1-last=Daniels |editor2-first=Candace |editor2-last=Sandy |title=Souls of my Sisters: Black women break their silence, tell their stories, and heal their spirits |accessdate= |year=2000 |publisher=Dafina Books |location= |isbn=1-57566-653-7 |chapter=I Stretch My Hands to Thee }}</ref> Saxton holds a bachelor’s degree in Deaf Education from the [[University of Massachusetts Amherst]] and has done graduate work at the [[University of the District of Columbia]]. ===Career=== She began her practice of interpreting for the deaf at Shiloh Baptist Church in Washington, D.C.. Saxton is a certified interpreter and is a member of [[Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf]]. She has taught introductory ASL classes and master workshops on interpreting music across the country. ===Marriage and children=== Shirley Childress Saxton is married to Pablo Saxton. She has two sons, Reginald and Deon.<ref name="souls"/> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Saxton, Shirley Childress | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American educator | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Saxton, Shirley Childress}} [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:African-American educators]] [[Category:Interpreters]] [[Category:People from Washington, D.C.]] [[Category:University of Massachusetts Amherst alumni]] [[Category:University of the District of Columbia]]
